FEATURED EVENTS





 

 
Admit Weekend 2023!

This event serves as an introduction to the vibrant, diverse community, and all of the people who help us remember and build on the legacy Black students have built.





Apr
28




Admit Weekend: Black Community Welcome Event

Calling at incoming students!   Friday, April 28, 2023 | 3:30pm
 - 5:00pm PDT
 Tresidder Oak Lounge
498 Santa Teresa Street
Stanford, CA 94305
United States 












 

 
Our Mission
The Black Community Services Center embodies inclusive excellence through partnering with and educating the Stanford community about the contributions of the African Diaspora, while ensuring that students can thrive and reach their full potential. We center our work around Academic / Intellectual exploration, Community Building, Alumni Engagement, Leadership Development, and Mental Health & Wellbeing. 


 
A New World in the Making
This year’s theme is: New World in the Making. We are asking the community to consider how we will move forward in this space of newness through the year. This will be the first time, in a long time, restrictions have been lifted; but we are still living through a growing list of pandemics. How are we moving forward, while still holding ourselves and each other accountable to safety measures for public health. How are we celebrating? Resting? Working/studying? What will we retain from the past, and what will we create in the present? How do we envision a future on a campus that understands Black lives matter? It’s a lot to think about, but we have a whole school year to ponder and respond! Join the Black Community Services Center as we explore the Black excellence and beauty that will grow in this new world.
